CodeList.Name: Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology Clinician-Rated Version Clinical Classification Test Code

Description.TranslatedText: Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology Clinician-Rated Version test code.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Sleep onset insomnia.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Mid-nocturnal insomnia.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Early morning insomnia.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Hypersomnia.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Mood (sad).
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Mood (irritable).
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Mood (anxious).
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Reactivity of mood.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Mood variation.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Is mood typically worse in morning, afternoon, or night.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: IDS-C - Mood Worse in Morning, Afternoon, or Night

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Is mood variation attributed to environment by the patient?
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: IDS-C - Mood Variation Attributed to Environment

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Quality of mood.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Appetite (decreased).
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Appetite (increased).

Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Weight (decrease) within the last two weeks.

Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Weight (increase) within the last two weeks.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Concentration/decision making.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Outlook (self).
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Outlook (future).
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Suicidal ideation.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Involvement.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Energy/fatiguability.

Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Pleasure/enjoyment (exclude sexual activities).
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Sexual interest.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Psychomotor slowing.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Psychomotor agitation.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Somatic complaints.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Sympathetic arousal.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Panic/phobic symptoms.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Gastrointestinal.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Interpersonal sensitivity.
Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Please circle one response to each item that best describes the patient for the last seven days: Leaden paralysis/physical energy.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: IDS-C - Leaden Paralysis or Physical Energy

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Clinician-Rated - Score.

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology Clinician-Rated Version Clinical Classification Test Code
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC Clinical Classification IDS-C Test Code Terminology
